1.text: Elders who are among you, I exhort, who am a fellow-elder, and a witness of the sufferings of the Christ, and of the glory about to be revealed a partaker,

2.text: feed the flock of God that is among you, overseeing not constrainedly, but willingly, neither for filthy lucre, but of a ready mind,

3.text: neither as exercising lordship over the heritages, but patterns becoming of the flock,

4.text: and at the manifestation of the chief Shepherd, ye shall receive the unfading crown of glory.

5.text: In like manner, ye younger, be subject to elders, and all to one another subjecting yourselves; with humble-mindedness clothe yourselves, because God the proud doth resist, but to the humble He doth give grace;

6.text: be humbled, then, under the powerful hand of God, that you He may exalt in good time,

7.text: all your care having cast upon Him, because He careth for you.

8.text: Be sober, vigilant, because your opponent the devil, as a roaring lion, doth walk about, seeking whom he may swallow up,

9.text: whom resist, stedfast in the faith, having known the same sufferings to your brotherhood in the world to be accomplished.

10.text: And the God of all grace, who did call you to His age-during glory in Christ Jesus, having suffered a little, Himself make you perfect, establish, strengthen, settle you;

11.text: to Him is the glory, and the powerâ€”to the ages and the ages! Amen.

12.text: Through Silvanus, to you the faithful brother, as I reckon, through few words I did write, exhorting and testifying this to be the true grace of God in which ye have stood.

13.text: Salute you doth the assembly in Babylon jointly elected, and Markus my son.

14.text: Salute ye one another in a kiss of love; peace to you all who are in Christ Jesus! Amen.
